IBERIA
Madrid, Spain
August 3, 1954
LINEAS AEREAS ESPANOLAS
This cover is being sent you on IBERIA'S Inaugural Flight of
its direct service between Madrid and New York.
We sincerely
hope you will find it an interesting memento of our
initial
flight on the 462nd Anniversary of the start of Columbus!
Voyage of Discovery of America.
The airplane bringing you the memento is one of a fleet of 3
Lockheed Super E Constellations -- named the Nina, the Pinta
and the Santa Maria, in memory of Christopher Columbus' own
ships.
For that reason, IBERIA'S New York -- Madrid service
is known as "The Route of the Sky Caravels."
The Lockheed aircraft is the newest type of Super Constellation.
The faster turbo-compound engines, more spacious cabins and a
revolutionary luxury interior give these latest Constellations
unequalled passenger appeal and operating efficiency.
fleet provides a blend of speed, luxury and comfort which con-
stitutes a new concept of air travel.
Our thanks for your interest in IBERIA, and our sincere hope
that this philatelic memento will please you.
IBERIA
Air Lines of Spain
HE ROUTE
LITHO IN U.S.A
10 - I
THE
SKY CARAVEL
S
properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover, Iberia, commemorating the first flight from Madrid to New York and back; printed red cachet with image of airplane and sailing ship, additional stamped red cachet; postmarked August 2, 1954 in Madrid over three stamps; backstamp: August 4, 1954 in New York; addressed to Iberia Air Lines of Spain;a. envelope;b. insert.
properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: Iberia, first flight, Madrid - New York - Madrid
